title: GM's Barra to Chair  Business Roundtable  ----  By Maria Armental
text:
General Motors Co. Chief Executive Mary Barra has been appointed the next chairman of the Business Roundtable, a trade group representing U.S. business interests in Washington, D.C.

On Jan. 1, Ms. Barra will take over as chairman of the coalition of chief executives of some of the biggest U.S. companies. She will be the first woman to lead the Business Roundtable.

She succeeds Walmart Inc. CEO Doug McMillon, who will remain on the board when he completes his two-year term on Dec. 31.

Previous leaders include Jamie Dimon, chief executive of JPMorgan Chase & Co., and Doug Oberhelman, then-CEO of Caterpillar Inc.

Ms. Barra, who joined the Business Roundtable in 2017, takes over as companies grapple with the economic disruption from the pandemic as well as calls to address racial equity and justice.

In prepared remarks, Ms. Barra said she appreciated Mr. McMillion's leadership through such challenges during his tenure.

Business Roundtable President and Chief Executive Joshua Bolten said that as chairman of the education and workforce committee, Ms. Barra had engaged CEOs and policy makers on policies and initiatives to prepare American workers.
